title: Leviticus Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Leviticus with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 27 chapters.

questions.question: Who did the LORD call to speak to the children of Israel about offerings?
questions.explanation: The LORD called unto Moses to speak to the children of Israel about offerings.

questions.question: What kind of animal should be offered for a burnt sacrifice from the herd?
questions.explanation: For a burnt sacrifice of the herd, a male without blemish must be offered.

questions.question: Where was the burnt offering to be killed?
options: At the entrance of the tabernacle
questions.explanation: The offering was to be killed on the side of the altar northward before the LORD.

questions.question: What must be done with the inwards and legs of the burnt offering?
questions.explanation: The inwards and legs shall be washed with water before burning the offering.

questions.question: Which birds were acceptable for burnt offerings?
questions.explanation: The offering of turtledoves or young pigeons was acceptable for burnt offerings.

questions.question: Who were responsible for sprinkling the blood on the altar?
questions.explanation: The priests, who were Aaron's sons, sprinkled the blood upon the altar.

questions.question: What part of the peace offering was given to the priests as their portion?
options: The right shoulder and wave breast
questions.correctAnswer: The right shoulder and wave breast
questions.explanation: Aaron and his sons received the wave breast and the heave shoulder from peace offerings by statute.

questions.question: What law is given concerning the eating of fat from animals?
options: It is holy and must be eaten by priests only
It shall not be eaten by anyone
It may be eaten by anyone
Only the fat of clean animals may be eaten
questions.correctAnswer: It shall not be eaten by anyone
questions.explanation: The children of Israel were commanded not to eat any manner of fat from ox, sheep, or goat.

questions.question: What is forbidden to be eaten according to Leviticus 7?
questions.explanation: Eating any blood or fat from sacrifices is forbidden and the soul that does so shall be cut off.

questions.question: Who may eat the meat of the trespass offering?
questions.explanation: Every male among the priests may eat of the trespass offering; it is most holy and eaten in the holy place.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the priest laying his hand upon the head of the burnt offering?
options: To make atonement for the offerer
questions.correctAnswer: To make atonement for the offerer
questions.explanation: The laying on of hands symbolized the transfer of sin and made atonement for the person offering.

questions.question: What was the sin offering for?
questions.explanation: The sin offering was made to atone for sins committed unintentionally.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an acceptable animal for a sin offering?
options: A female without blemish from the herd
A male without blemish from the flock
questions.explanation: Only domestic animals without blemish or certain birds were accepted for sin offerings, not wild animals.

questions.question: How long was a person with a scab or bright spot to be shut up when the plague was not deeper than the skin?
questions.explanation: The priest was to shut up the person seven days and then inspect again.

questions.question: If the plague spread on the skin after the second examination, what was the priest to declare?
questions.explanation: If the plague spread, the priest declared the person unclean due to leprosy.

questions.question: What is the penalty for eating blood according to Leviticus 7?
questions.explanation: The soul that eats blood shall be cut off from his people.

questions.question: Which chapter in Leviticus provides detailed laws about leprosy and skin diseases?
questions.explanation: Leviticus 13 contains laws about diagnosing and managing leprosy and skin diseases.

questions.question: Who was responsible for examining those suspected of leprosy?
options: Aaron the priest or his sons
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron the priest or his sons
questions.explanation: The priests, Aaron or his sons, were charged with examining leprous conditions.

questions.question: What is the sign of a plague of leprosy on the skin according to the priest's examination?
options: Hair turned white and plague deeper than skin
Dark scab with no hair change
questions.correctAnswer: Hair turned white and plague deeper than skin
questions.explanation: A plague with white hair and deeper than skin indicates leprosy.

questions.question: What was to be done with the crop and feathers of a bird burnt offering?
options: Cast beside the altar on the east part
questions.correctAnswer: Cast beside the altar on the east part
questions.explanation: The crop and feathers were cast beside the altar on the east part by the place of the ashes.

questions.question: What was the punishment for a soul that ate flesh of peace offerings with uncleanness on him?
options: He shall be cut off from his people
He shall be excommunicated for a year
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be cut off from his people
questions.explanation: Eating sacred flesh while unclean causes the soul to be cut off from the people.

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT listed as fat to be removed from the trespass offering?
questions.explanation: The heart is not listed among the fats to be removed; rump, kidneys, and caul are.

questions.question: What was the requirement for animals offered as burnt offerings regarding blemishes?
questions.explanation: Burnt offerings had to be a male animal without blemish.

questions.question: How were the priests to handle the skin of the burnt offering?
options: Take it to their own possession
questions.correctAnswer: Take it to their own possession
questions.explanation: The skin of the burnt offering belonged to the priest who offered it.

questions.question: What is the significance of Leviticus 4:35 regarding the sin offering?
options: It states the sin offering makes atonement
questions.correctAnswer: It states the sin offering makes atonement
questions.explanation: Leviticus 4:35 explains that the sin offering makes atonement for the sinner.

questions.question: What was the priest to do if a leprous boil healed but left a white spot?
questions.explanation: If the white spot was not lower than the skin and no white hair was present, the priest shut him up seven days.

questions.question: Who may eat the meat offering mingled with oil and dry?
questions.explanation: All the sons of Aaron have equal portions of the dry meat offering mingled with oil.

questions.question: What was the consequence of eating the flesh of the peace offerings on the third day?
options: It would be accepted if offered again
It was allowed if cooked well
questions.explanation: Eating peace offering flesh on the third day was abominable and sin to the eater.

questions.question: What did the LORD command Moses on Mount Sinai related to sacrifices?
options: To teach the children of Israel to offer oblations
questions.correctAnswer: To teach the children of Israel to offer oblations
questions.explanation: The LORD commanded Moses to teach Israel to offer their oblations in the wilderness of Sinai.

questions.question: True or False: The priests were allowed to eat the skin of the burnt offering they presented.
questions.explanation: The priests had the right to keep and eat the skin of burnt offerings they offered.

questions.question: True or False: A burnt offering could be either male or female animals without blemish.
questions.explanation: Burnt offerings had to be male animals without blemish.

questions.question: True or False: The priests were to eat the trespass offering in the holy place, as it is most holy.
questions.explanation: The trespass offering was most holy and eaten by the priests in the holy place.

questions.question: True or False: The fat of animals that die of themselves may be eaten by the children of Israel.
questions.explanation: Fat of animals that die of themselves may not be eaten but may be used for other purposes.

questions.question: True or False: The priest was to pronounce a person with white hair in a plague on the skin as clean if the plague covered all his flesh and was all turned white.
questions.explanation: If the leprosy covered all flesh and was white, the priest pronounced the person clean.

questions.question: True or False: The priest was to shut up a person with a bright spot in the skin for 3 days only.
questions.explanation: The priest was to shut up the person for seven days, not three.

questions.question: True or False: Eating blood was prohibited and the eater would be cut off from his people.
questions.explanation: Eating any kind of blood was forbidden and resulted in being cut off from the people.

questions.question: True or False: The right shoulder of the peace offering was given to the priests as a heave offering.
questions.explanation: The right shoulder was given to the priests as a heave offering from peace offerings.

questions.question: Fill-blank: Complete this verse: "And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make ______ for him."
questions.explanation: The laying on of hands is to make atonement for the offerer.

questions.question: Fill-blank: Complete this verse: "And the priests, Aaron's sons, shall sprinkle his blood round about upon the altar that is by the door of the tabernacle of the ______."
questions.explanation: The altar is at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

questions.question: Fill-blank: Complete this verse: "Every male among the priests shall eat thereof: it shall be eaten in the holy place: it is most ______."
questions.explanation: The trespass offering is most holy and eaten by male priests in the holy place.

questions.question: Fill-blank: Complete this verse: "And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, Ye shall eat no manner of ______, of ox, or of sheep, or of goat."
questions.explanation: The Israelites were commanded not to eat any fat of ox, sheep, or goat.
